result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles John Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Good Time Credit; with credit for 0 days time served. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment
Defendant to register for probation and provide DNA sample by 3:00pm on June 30, 2022

miscConds.notes: Defendant ordered to pay all costs, penalties and surcharges, provide DNA sample; pay surcharge during probation or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
- Successfully complete Firearm Safety Class (may have gun for class only).
- Alcohol and Drug Assessment and comply with recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles John Walton in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles John Walton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  The court ordered defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, good time credit, with credit for -0- days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment.

Court stayed the Sentence and placed Defendant on probation for a period of 12 months.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Court ordered Defendant to perform 30 hours of community service.
*No alcohol.
*No weapons.
*Successfully complete firearm safety class (may have gun for class only)

Defendant ordered to pay all costs, penalties and surcharges, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge during probation or to be docketed as a civil judgment.    Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

Defendant to register for probation and provide DNA sample by 3:00 pm on June 30, 2022.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  bm
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  bm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  bm
Elements of the Offense received and filed.  bm

Defendant Charles John Walton in court with attorney Ben Luechen on behalf of Zachary Hoff.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case may possibly resolve as a DPA. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defense's Adjournment Letter

Defendant Charles John Walton in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles John Walton appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Charles John Walton in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles John Walton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defnes counsel requests status confernce date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Charles John Walton in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/1/22 @ 2p
